text.div:
DetectedNotDetectedVS ValueSet

Value set consisting of the answers Detected (Present) and NotDetected (Absent). The terms detected and not detected are preferred because they reflect outcomes of experimental observation, while present and absent suggest ground truth. This value set reconciles or combines LOINC answer lists LL956-4

name: DetectedNotDetectedVS
title: DetectedNotDetectedVS
publisher: HL7 Patient Care and Clinical Information Modeling Initiative Work Groups
description: Value set consisting of the answers Detected (Present) and NotDetected (Absent). The terms detected and not detected are preferred because they reflect outcomes of experimental observation, while present and absent suggest ground truth. This value set reconciles or combines LOINC answer lists LL956-4

concept.display: Equivocal (qualifier value). Equivocal represents a borderline value, too close to call; for example, a value very close to a cut-off between positive and negative
Indeterminate (qualifier value). Indeterminate means the results were uninterpretable, or cannot be determined; technical issues prevented obtaining a valid result.
